comments:
I20070503-1400 (M7)

I can easily reproduce this error in my environment, so if more info is needed, please let me know.

I applied this patch:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=65593&action=view
to the org.eclipse.swt.examples project in my workspace (I have the version in HEAD loaded, but this is the same as the version tagged v3337).

This patch adds a file called org.eclipse.pde.prefs and it modifies plugin.xml.

When I try to compare the patched plugin.xml with the original (v3337) plugin.xml, I get an "internal error 135". Here's the stack trace from the .log:


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-05-08 12:59:31.406
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Update comparison plugin.xml".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 135
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.AbstractMatching.dist(AbstractMatching.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.AbstractMatching$XMLComparator.rangesEqual(AbstractMatching.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.compare.rangedifferencer.RangeComparatorLCS.isRangeEqual(RangeComparatorLCS.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.compare.internal.LCS.longestCommonSubsequence(LCS.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.compare.rangedifferencer.RangeComparatorLCS.findDifferences(RangeComparatorLCS.java:29)
	at org.eclipse.compare.rangedifferencer.RangeDifferencer.findDifferences(RangeDifferencer.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.compare.rangedifferencer.RangeDifferencer.findDifferences(RangeDifferencer.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.AbstractMatching.handleRangeDifferencer(AbstractMatching.java:182)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.OrderedMatching.orderedMath(OrderedMatching.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.OrderedMatching.handleXandYnotLeaves(OrderedMatching.java:215)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.AbstractMatching.dist(AbstractMatching.java:307)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.OrderedMatching.match(OrderedMatching.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.XMLStructureViewer.performMatching(XMLStructureViewer.java:541)
	at org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml.XMLStructureViewer.preDiffHook(XMLStructureViewer.java:232)
	at org.eclipse.compare.structuremergeviewer.StructureDiffViewer.diff(StructureDiffViewer.java:461)
	at org.eclipse.compare.structuremergeviewer.StructureDiffViewer$1.run(StructureDiffViewer.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.compare.internal.Worker.performNextTask(Worker.java:116)
	at org.eclipse.compare.internal.Worker.run(Worker.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.compare.internal.WorkerJob.run(WorkerJob.java:30)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
I've seen this before too but I haven't had a chance to work on the Example yet. We shoudl have time to look into this is RC1.

OK.

Just to confirm, I deleted the two compare examples folders from my eclipse plugins directory and restarted eclipse with -clean, and the problem went away.
  org.eclipse.compare.examples.xml_3.3.0.I20061127
  org.eclipse.compare.examples_3.1.100.v20060606

Created an attachment (id=66346)
Patch that prevents the error

It turns out that the example made an invalid assumption about the parameter ordering of a particular call. The patch I've attached reverses the parameters and hence "fixes" the problem. It would be good if we could provide a real fix though.
I've released the patch to HEAD.
